text: Department of Justice's Alexander Acosta, and he served almost 13 months in custody but with extensive work release.[12] Epstein was arrested again on July 6, 2019, on federal charges for the sex trafficking of minors in Florida and New York.[13][14] He died in his jail cell on August 10, 2019.[15] Barbara Sampson, the New York City medical examiner, controversially ruled that his death was a suicide by hanging.[16] Forensic pathologist Michael Baden has disputed the ruling, and there has been significant public skepticism about the true cause of his death, resulting in conspiracy theories.[17][18] In July 2025, the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) released closed-circuit television (CCTV) footage to support the conclusion that Epstein died by suicide in his jail cell.[19][20] When the Department of Justice released the footage, approximately 2 minutes and 53 seconds of it was missing,[21][22] and the video was found to have been modified despite the FBI's claim that it was raw.[23] Since Epstein's death precluded the possibility of pursuing criminal charges against him, a judge dismissed all criminal charges on August 29, 2019.
source: Jeffrey Epstein - Wikipedia

text: Epstein & Co., in 1982.[7] His investment bank managed the assets of every person who had invested at his investments bank.[7] As of 2002, his investment bank was worth more than US $1 billion.[7] Criminal history[change | change source] First signs of criminal activity (2005–06)[change | change source] Palm Beach report[change | change source] In March 2005, a woman told Florida's Palm Beach Police Department that her 14-year-old stepdaughter had been taken to Epstein's mansion by an older girl.[19] The woman claimed that in the mansion, her stepdaughter was paid $300 to strip and massage Epstein.[7][20] The stepdaughter was claimed to be undressed.

text: Epstein & CompanyRelativesMark Epstein (brother)Criminal chargeProcuring a child for prostitutionsex traffickingPenalty13 months' imprisonment (2008)AccompliceGhislaine MaxwellDetailsVictims1,000+[1][2] Signature Jeffrey Edward Epstein[a] (January 20, 1953 – August 10, 2019) was an American financier, child sex offender, serial rapist, and human trafficker.[5][6] He began his professional career as a teacher (without a degree) at the Dalton School.

text: Epstein cultivated an elite social circle[7] and procured at least 1,000 underage girls and women[8] who were subjected to repeated rape and sexual violence by him and his associates.[9][10] In 2005, police in Palm Beach, Florida, began investigating Epstein after a parent reported that he had sexually abused her 14-year-old daughter.

text: Federal officials identified 36 girls, some as young as 14 years old, whom Epstein had allegedly sexually abused.[11] Epstein pleaded guilty and was convicted in 2008 by a Florida state court of procuring a child for prostitution and of soliciting a prostitute.

text: Florida grand jury transcripts are usually kept secret forever, but the bill created an exemption for cases like Epstein's.The transcripts show that the grand jury heard testimony that Epstein, who was then in his 40s, had raped teenage girls as young as 14 at his Palm Beach mansion, often paying them so he could commit statutory rape or assault.

text: He spent 13 months in "custody with work release", which means that he was allowed to be outside of prison for up to 16 hours per day.[8] Epstein was arrested again on July 6, 2019[9] for sex trafficking of minors in Florida and New York.[10] Epstein was a registered sex offender from 2008 until his death.[6] On August 10, 2019, he killed himself by hanging.[11][12] The medical examiner told the court that Epstein died by suicide,[13] but Epstein's lawyers disagreed.[14][15] On August 29, 2019, the judge decided to end the criminal investigation of Epstein.[16][17] Career[change | change source] Epstein taught physics at the Dalton School in Manhattan between 1973 and 1975.[7] In 1976, Epstein started work at Bear Stearns as an options trader (a job where stock brokers sell instruments giving customers the option to buy or sell stocks at a set price at a future date).[7] There, he advised very rich people on financial strategies relating to taxes.[7] He was shown to be a successful worker during his financial career, and Epstein was promoted to a limited partner (a job that manages money within a company) at Bear Stearns in 1980.[7][18] Epstein founded his investment bank, J.
source: Jeffrey Epstein - Simple English Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

text: He was convicted of only these two crimes as part of a controversial plea deal agreed by the U.S.

mugshotBornJeffrey Edward Epstein(1953-01-20)January 20, 1953New York City, U.S.DiedAugust 10, 2019(2019-08-10) (aged 66)New York City, U.S.Cause of deathSuicide by hanging (disputed)[1] [2]NationalityAmericanEducationCooper Union  (no degree)New York University (no degree)Political partyDemocratic[3]Criminal charge(s)Sex offender, Sex traffickingCriminal penalty13 months (2008) Jeffrey Edward Epstein (January 20, 1953 – August 10, 2019[4]) was an American financier and sex offender.[5][6] He started his career in an investment bank called Bear Stearns.
source: Jeffrey Epstein - Simple English Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

text: Rather than prosecute Epstein, Alex Acosta, a former United States Attorney, brokered a deal with Epstein’s defense attorneys coined, “the sweetheart deal of the century.” When Acosta abdicated his role as a state functionary and allowed Epstein’s defense attorneys to dictate the terms of Epstein’s freedom, Acosta gave the power of the State to private parties to protect a recidivist child rapist.The failure to prosecute Epstein is all the more problematic because it sits at the epicenter of mass incarceration.
source: "Jeffrey Epstein: Pedophiles, Prosecutors, and Power" by Blanche Bong Cook

text: The interviews revealed that photos of abused underaged girls were found in Epstein's trash.[23] In fact, some of the trashed photos were confirmed to match the interviewed victims.[21][24] Cameras & blackmail[change | change source] In 2006, it was discovered[by whom?] that Epstein often secretly installed cameras everywhere around his property.[25] He used these cameras to record sexual activity between underage girls and famous people.[25][26] It was also discovered[by whom?] that Epstein used secret recordings and underage spies to blackmail those famous people.[22][26] These criminal claims were obtained from information relating to a previous lawsuit made by those famous people in 2006[clarification needed].[26] In 2015, it was revealed that then Prince Andrew, Duke of York had been blackmailed by Epstein.[22] One of Epstein's former employees stated that Epstein would receive three massages per day from underaged girls.[21] Eventually the FBI received proof that indeed Epstein was blackmailing famous people by spying on them.[22] Defense[change | change source] In May 2006, the Palm Beach police had concluded that Jeffrey Epstein would be charged with four counts of unlawful sex with minors and one count of molestation (forcing sexual abuse).[21][27] However, the court disagreed.
source: Jeffrey Epstein - Simple English Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

history" following transcripts release            Updated on:  July 1, 2024 / 7:21 PM EDT             / AP                   Add CBS News on Google      A Florida judge released Monday afternoon the transcripts of a 2006 grand jury investigation that looked into sex trafficking and rape allegations made against the late millionaire and financier Jeffrey Epstein.The investigation was the first of many by law enforcement over the past two decades into Epstein's rape and sex trafficking of teenagers - and how his ties to the rich and the powerful seem to have allowed him to avoid prison or a serious jail term for over a decade.

text: federal charges of sex trafficking and conspiracy for helping him procure girls, including a 14-year-old, for child sexual abuse and prostitution.[25][26][27] According to The New York Times, Epstein made much of his fortune by providing tax and estate services to billionaires.[28] He was also a renowned social networker, whose vast network included business people, royalty, politicians and academics.[29] His friendships with public figures including Donald Trump, Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor and Bill Clinton have attracted significant controversy.[30][31][32][33] Documents released by the House Democratic Caucus in September 2025 show that he maintained connections with Peter Thiel, Elon Musk, Bill Gates, Larry Summers, and Steve Bannon.[34] In January 2026 more Epstein files were released, showing extensive contact with Ehud Barak, Steve Tisch, Howard Lutnick, Kathy Ruemmler and Mette-Marit, Crown Princess of Norway.[35][36][37]   Early life Epstein's childhood neighborhood of Sea Gate, Brooklyn Jeffrey Edward Epstein was born on January 20, 1953, in Brooklyn[38][39] a borough of New York City.
